intro: Leptilon bonariense, commonly known as the Argentine starflower, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has palmate leaves with a soft, velvety texture. It is often found in temperate regions of Argentina and Brazil. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside its native range.
